Associate Professor of English teaching courses in Shakespeare, early modern drama, dramatic literature, and book history. Books: "Playwriting Playgoers in Shakespeare's Theaters" (2017), "Shakespeare's Audiences" (2021), and "Teaching the History of the Book" (2023). note: Academic. Interdisciplinary-minded espresso lover. Classics, modern-contemporary literature, digital humanities, electronic literature, interactive fiction. Goes for bike rides, snowshoes, takes long walks. Stays up too late reading. Equally at home in a pine forest by the sea on the eastern coast of the US as in the lovely snowland of Edmonton, AB. Same handle on Twitter where I'll also still be for now.

Academic who works on smells past, present, and future. First book: https://global.oup.com/academic/product/smell-in-eighteenth-century-england-9780192847454?lang=en&cc=gb. Second book: https://www.bloomsbury.com/us/smell-and-the-past-9781350367524/ (will be free pdf!). Main project right now: https://odeuropa.eu/.
